sub_topic: Prove that every group of order 72 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C72, the alternating group A4 × C3 × C2, or one of the 51 non-abelian groups of order 72.
message_1: What is the number of non-isomorphic groups of order 72 and what are they?
message_2:
There are 10 non-isomorphic groups of order 72. They are as follows:

1. C_72 (cyclic group of order 72)
2. C_36 × C_2 (direct product of cyclic groups of orders 36 and 2)
3. C_24 × C_3 (direct product of cyclic groups of orders 24 and 3)
4. C_12 × C_6 (direct product of cyclic groups of orders 12 and 6)
5. C_9 × C_8 (direct product of cyclic groups of orders 9 and 8)
6. C_9 × (C_4 × C_2) (direct product of cyclic groups of orders 9, 4, and 2)
7. C_3 × C_4 × C_6 (direct product of cyclic groups of orders 3, 4, and 6)
8. C_3 × (C_2 × C_4 × C_2) (direct product of cyclic groups of orders 3, 2, 4, and 2)
9. (C_3 × C_3) ⋊ C_8 (semidirect product of direct product of cyclic groups of orders 3 and 3 with cyclic group of order 8)
10. (C_3 × C_3) ⋊ C_4 (semidirect product of direct product of cyclic groups of orders 3 and 3 with cyclic group of order 4)

These groups can be found using the Sylow theorems and considering the possible structures of the Sylow subgroups.
